intro: Josephia falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed josephia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Josephia falcata is often found in chaparral and scrubland habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
